name: shadcn/ui
description: Beautifully designed components built with Radix UI and Tailwind CSS

components.name: accordion
components.description: Vertically stacked collapsible sections with interactive headers. Supports single or multiple open items. Built on Radix primitives for accessibility.

type.description: Whether one or multiple items can be opened at once

components.usage: import { Accordion, AccordionContent, AccordionItem, AccordionTrigger } from '@/components/ui/accordion'

examples.title: Single Accordion
examples.code:
<Accordion type='single' collapsible>
  <AccordionItem value='item-1'>
    <AccordionTrigger>Is it accessible?</AccordionTrigger>
    <AccordionContent>Yes. It adheres to the WAI-ARIA design pattern.</AccordionContent>
  </AccordionItem>
</Accordion>

components.useCase: Organizing extensive content into collapsible sections (FAQs).
components.embeddingContext: An accordion organizes content into collapsible sections with expandable headers. Also known as: collapsible, expandable, faq, disclosure, toggle panel. Supports single mode (only one open at a time) or multiple mode (many can be open). Features smooth animations, keyboard navigation, and ARIA attributes. Parts include AccordionItem (section), AccordionTrigger (clickable header), and AccordionContent (collapsible body).

implementation.importSpecifier: import { Accordion, AccordionContent, AccordionItem, AccordionTrigger } from '@/components/ui/accordion'

keyProps.name: type
keyProps.description: Allow one or multiple items open

keyProps.name: collapsible
keyProps.description: Allow closing the open item (single mode)

components.name: alert
components.description: Displays a callout for user attention
components.usage: import { Alert, AlertDescription, AlertTitle } from '@/components/ui/alert'

examples.title: Default Alert
examples.code:
<Alert>
  <AlertTitle>Heads up!</AlertTitle>
  <AlertDescription>You can add components to your app.</AlertDescription>
</Alert>

components.useCase: Displaying important status messages to the user.
components.embeddingContext: Displays a callout for user attention Also known as: notification banner, message box, info callout, status message. Related concepts: notification, warning, error, info. Primary use case: Displaying important status messages to the user. Composed of parts: AlertTitle, AlertDescription.

components.name: alert-dialog
components.description: Modal dialog that interrupts the user with important content
components.usage: import { AlertDialog, AlertDialogAction, AlertDialogCancel, AlertDialogContent, AlertDialogDescription, AlertDialogFooter, AlertDialogHeader, AlertDialogTitle, AlertDialogTrigger } from '@/components/ui/alert-dialog'

examples.title: Confirmation Dialog
examples.code:
<AlertDialog>
  <AlertDialogTrigger asChild>
    <Button variant='outline'>Delete Account</Button>
  </AlertDialogTrigger>
  <AlertDialogContent>
    <AlertDialogHeader>
      <AlertDialogTitle>Are you sure?</AlertDialogTitle>
      <AlertDialogDescription>This action cannot be undone.</AlertDialogDescription>
    </AlertDialogHeader>
    <AlertDialogFooter>
      <AlertDialogCancel>Cancel</AlertDialogCancel>
      <AlertDialogAction>Continue</AlertDialogAction>
    </AlertDialogFooter>
  </AlertDialogContent>
</AlertDialog>

components.useCase: Interrupting user to confirm a dangerous action.
components.embeddingContext: Modal dialog that interrupts the user with important content Also known as: confirmation dialog, warning modal, confirm popup, interrupt dialog. Related concepts: modal, confirm, warning, overlay. Primary use case: Interrupting user to confirm a dangerous action. Composed of parts: AlertDialogTrigger, AlertDialogContent, AlertDialogHeader, AlertDialogFooter, AlertDialogTitle, AlertDialogDescription, AlertDialogAction, AlertDialogCancel.

components.name: button
components.description: A clickable interactive element that triggers actions. Built on Radix Slot for composition. Supports multiple variants (default, destructive, outline, secondary, ghost, link) and sizes (default, sm, lg, icon, icon-sm, icon-lg). Fully accessible with keyboard navigation.
components.usage: import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button'
components.useCase: Triggering actions or submitting forms.
components.embeddingContext: A button is a fundamental interactive element that users click to trigger actions, submit forms, or navigate. Also known as: CTA, call-to-action, action button, submit button, clickable element. Supports variants for visual hierarchy (primary, secondary, destructive for danger actions, ghost for subtle, link for navigation). Sizes include default, small, large, and icon-only. Accessible via keyboard (Enter/Space). Built on Radix UI Slot for composition with asChild prop.

keyProps.name: asChild
keyProps.description: Render as child component for composition

components.name: calendar
components.description: Date picker component with calendar view
components.usage: import { Calendar } from '@/components/ui/calendar'

examples.title: Single Date Picker
Date Range Picker

components.useCase: Selecting dates from a monthly view.
components.embeddingContext: Date picker component with calendar view Also known as: date picker, date selector, month view, date calendar. Related concepts: date, picker, time, input. Primary use case: Selecting dates from a monthly view.

components.name: card
components.description: A flexible container component for grouping related content with optional header, body, and footer sections. Commonly used for product displays, profiles, or information panels.
components.usage: import { Card, CardContent, CardDescription, CardFooter, CardHeader, CardTitle } from '@/components/ui/card'
components.useCase: Grouping related content and actions in a container.
components.embeddingContext: A card is a versatile container that groups related content and actions. Also known as: panel, box, tile, container, content card, info card. Typically composed of Header (with Title and Description), Content (main body), and Footer (actions). Used for product listings, user profiles, dashboard widgets, or any grouped information. Supports custom styling via className.

implementation.importSpecifier: import { Card, CardContent, CardDescription, CardFooter, CardHeader, CardTitle } from '@/components/ui/card'

components.name: combobox
components.description: Autocomplete input and command palette with a list of suggestions
components.note: Built using Popover and Command components
components.usage:
import { Command, CommandInput, CommandList, CommandItem } from '@/components/ui/command'
import { Popover, PopoverContent, PopoverTrigger } from '@/components/ui/popover'

examples.title: Framework Selector
examples.code:
<Popover open={open} onOpenChange={setOpen}>
  <PopoverTrigger asChild>
    <Button variant='outline' role='combobox'>
      {value || 'Select framework...'}
    </Button>
  </PopoverTrigger>
  <PopoverContent>
    <Command>
      <CommandInput placeholder='Search framework...' />
      <CommandList>
        <CommandItem onSelect={setValue}>Next.js</CommandItem>
        <CommandItem onSelect={setValue}>React</CommandItem>
      </CommandList>
    </Command>
  </PopoverContent>
</Popover>

components.useCase: Selecting an item from a large list with search.
components.embeddingContext: Autocomplete input and command palette with a list of suggestions Also known as: autocomplete, searchable select, typeahead, command palette select. Related concepts: input, select, search, autocomplete. Primary use case: Selecting an item from a large list with search.

examples.title: Command Menu
examples.code:

  <CommandList>
    <CommandEmpty>No results found.</CommandEmpty>
    <CommandGroup heading='Suggestions'>
      <CommandItem>Calendar</CommandItem>
      <CommandItem>Search Emoji</CommandItem>
    </CommandGroup>
  </CommandList>
</Command>

components.name: dialog
components.description: A modal window that interrupts user workflow. Supports focus trapping, keyboard navigation (Escape to close), and accessible by default with ARIA attributes. Can be controlled or uncontrolled.
components.usage: import { Dialog, DialogContent, DialogDescription, DialogHeader, DialogTitle, DialogTrigger } from '@/components/ui/dialog'

examples.title: Basic Dialog
examples.code:
<Dialog>
  <DialogTrigger asChild>
    <Button>Open Dialog</Button>
  </DialogTrigger>
  <DialogContent>
    <DialogHeader>
      <DialogTitle>Are you sure?</DialogTitle>
      <DialogDescription>This action cannot be undone.</DialogDescription>
    </DialogHeader>
  </DialogContent>
</Dialog>

components.useCase: Focused task or content in a modal window.
components.embeddingContext: A dialog is a modal overlay window that interrupts the user to display critical information or request input. Also known as: modal, popup, lightbox, modal dialog, overlay window. Used for confirmations, form inputs, alerts, or focused tasks. Supports accessibility with focus trapping, Escape key to close, and screen reader announcements. Parts include Trigger, Content, Header, Footer, Title, Description, and Close button.

implementation.importSpecifier: import { Dialog, DialogContent, DialogDescription, DialogHeader, DialogTitle, DialogTrigger, DialogFooter, DialogClose } from '@/components/ui/dialog'

keyProps.name: modal
keyProps.description: Whether to render as modal (blocks interaction outside)

components.name: drawer
components.description: A mobile-first slide-out panel with physics-based animations and gesture support. Built on Vaul library. Supports swipe-to-dismiss and drag-to-resize.
components.usage: import { Drawer, DrawerClose, DrawerContent, DrawerDescription, DrawerFooter, DrawerHeader, DrawerTitle, DrawerTrigger } from '@/components/ui/drawer'

examples.title: Bottom Drawer
examples.code:
<Drawer>
  <DrawerTrigger asChild>
    <Button>Open Drawer</Button>
  </DrawerTrigger>
  <DrawerContent>
    <DrawerHeader>
      <DrawerTitle>Drawer Title</DrawerTitle>
      <DrawerDescription>Drawer description</DrawerDescription>
    </DrawerHeader>
    <DrawerFooter>
      <Button>Submit</Button>
      <DrawerClose asChild>
        <Button variant='outline'>Cancel</Button>
      </DrawerClose>
    </DrawerFooter>
  </DrawerContent>
</Drawer>

components.useCase: Pull-up panel, common on mobile devices.
components.embeddingContext: A drawer is a native app-style slide-out panel optimized for mobile with gesture support. Also known as: mobile sidebar, bottom sheet, sliding drawer, off-canvas menu. Features physics-based animations, swipe gestures to open/close, and drag-to-resize. Can combine with Dialog for responsive behavior (Drawer on mobile, Dialog on desktop). Ideal for quick actions, mobile navigation, or contextual content.

implementation.importSpecifier: import { Drawer, DrawerContent, DrawerDescription, DrawerHeader, DrawerTitle, DrawerTrigger, DrawerFooter, DrawerClose } from '@/components/ui/drawer'

components.name: form
components.description: Building forms with React Hook Form and Zod validation
components.usage: import { Form, FormControl, FormDescription, FormField, FormItem, FormLabel, FormMessage } from '@/components/ui/form'

examples.title: Form with Validation
examples.code:
const form = useForm({
  resolver: zodResolver(formSchema)
})

<Form {...form}>
  <form onSubmit={form.handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>
    <FormField
      control={form.control}
      name='username'
      render={({ field }) => (
        <FormItem>
          <FormLabel>Username</FormLabel>
          <FormControl>
            <Input placeholder='shadcn' {...field} />
          </FormControl>
          <FormMessage />
        </FormItem>
      )}
    />
    <Button type='submit'>Submit</Button>
  </form>
</Form>

components.useCase: Building validated forms with multiple inputs.
components.embeddingContext: Building forms with React Hook Form and Zod validation Also known as: form wrapper, form validation, input form, data entry. Related concepts: input, validation, group, data. Primary use case: Building validated forms with multiple inputs. Composed of parts: Form, FormItem, FormLabel, FormControl, FormDescription, FormMessage, FormField.

Provides consistent shadcn styling with focus states, disabled states, and error states via className. Accepts all native HTML input attributes including type, placeholder, disabled, and value.

  <InputOTPSeparator />
  <InputOTPGroup>

</InputOTP>

components.name: popover

examples.title: Basic Popover

Dimensions

Set dimensions

components.useCase: Small overlay content triggered by click.
components.embeddingContext: A popover is a floating panel that appears anchored to a trigger element. Also known as: popup, floating content, info bubble, dropdown panel. Unlike tooltips, popovers can contain rich interactive content like forms or menus. Features smart positioning with collision avoidance, focus management, and accessibility. Parts include PopoverTrigger and PopoverContent.

components.name: sheet
components.description: A sliding panel that enters from the edge of the viewport (left, right, top, or bottom). Built on Radix Dialog primitives for accessibility. Ideal for mobile navigation, settings panels, or detailed filters.

  <SheetContent>

components.useCase: Side-panel for navigation or details.
components.embeddingContext: A sheet is a sidebar component that slides in from the left, right, top, or bottom edge of the screen. Also known as: drawer, sidebar, slide-over, off-canvas panel, sliding panel. Used for mobile hamburger menus, edit forms, configuration panels, or displaying details without leaving context. Provides native app-like smooth animations with focus management. Parts include Trigger, Content, Header, Title, Description, and Footer.

implementation.importSpecifier: import { Sheet, SheetContent, SheetDescription, SheetHeader, SheetTitle, SheetTrigger, SheetFooter, SheetClose } from '@/components/ui/sheet'

keyProps.name: side
keyProps.description: Edge the sheet slides in from

components.name: sonner
components.description: Modern toast/notification component that replaces the deprecated Toast. Shows non-blocking alerts with smooth animations. Supports promise integration for async operations.
components.usage:
import { toast } from 'sonner'
import { Toaster } from '@/components/ui/sonner'

examples.title: Show Toast

components.useCase: Stackable toast notifications.
components.embeddingContext: Sonner is the modern toast notification system that replaces the deprecated shadcn Toast component. Also known as: toast, snackbar, notification, popup message, status toast, alert toast. Provides non-blocking notifications with smooth animations. Features promise integration for automatic loading/success/error states, mobile-optimized swipe-to-dismiss, and customizable positioning. Uses lucide icons since October 2025.

implementation.importSpecifier:
import { toast } from 'sonner';
import { Toaster } from '@/components/ui/sonner'

components.name: tabs
components.description: Tabbed interface for switching between content panels. Built on Radix primitives for full accessibility including keyboard navigation and ARIA labels.
components.usage: import { Tabs, TabsContent, TabsList, TabsTrigger } from '@/components/ui/tabs'

examples.title: Basic Tabs
examples.code:
<Tabs defaultValue='account'>
  <TabsList>
    <TabsTrigger value='account'>Account</TabsTrigger>
    <TabsTrigger value='password'>Password</TabsTrigger>
  </TabsList>
  <TabsContent value='account'>Account content</TabsContent>
  <TabsContent value='password'>Password content</TabsContent>
</Tabs>

components.useCase: Switching between views in the same context.
components.embeddingContext: Tabs provide a tabbed interface for organizing content into switchable panels. Also known as: tab switcher, tab navigation, segmented control, tab panel. Supports controlled and uncontrolled modes. Accessible with keyboard navigation (arrow keys) and ARIA labels. Can be oriented horizontally or vertically. Parts include TabsList (container), TabsTrigger (clickable tabs), and TabsContent (panel content).

implementation.importSpecifier: import { Tabs, TabsContent, TabsList, TabsTrigger } from '@/components/ui/tabs'

components.name: toggle
components.description: A two-state button that can be either on or off
components.usage: import { Toggle } from '@/components/ui/toggle'
components.useCase: Two-state button.
components.embeddingContext: A two-state button that can be either on or off Also known as: toggle button, pressed button, stateful button. Related concepts: button, switch, state, icon. Primary use case: Two-state button.

components.name: toggle-group
components.description: A set of two-state buttons that can be toggled on or off

type.description: Whether only one or multiple items can be pressed at a time

value.description: Controlled value (string for single, string[] for multiple)

spacing.description: Gap between toggle items (in spacing units)

components.usage: import { ToggleGroup, ToggleGroupItem } from '@/components/ui/toggle-group'

examples.title: Single Selection
examples.code:
<ToggleGroup type='single'>
  <ToggleGroupItem value='left' aria-label='Align left'>
    <AlignLeft className='h-4 w-4' />
  </ToggleGroupItem>
  <ToggleGroupItem value='center' aria-label='Align center'>
    <AlignCenter className='h-4 w-4' />
  </ToggleGroupItem>
  <ToggleGroupItem value='right' aria-label='Align right'>
    <AlignRight className='h-4 w-4' />
  </ToggleGroupItem>
</ToggleGroup>

examples.title: Multiple Selection
examples.code:
<ToggleGroup type='multiple'>
  <ToggleGroupItem value='bold' aria-label='Toggle bold'>
    <Bold className='h-4 w-4' />
  </ToggleGroupItem>
  <ToggleGroupItem value='italic' aria-label='Toggle italic'>
    <Italic className='h-4 w-4' />
  </ToggleGroupItem>
  <ToggleGroupItem value='underline' aria-label='Toggle underline'>
    <Underline className='h-4 w-4' />
  </ToggleGroupItem>
</ToggleGroup>

examples.title: With Spacing and Custom Styles
examples.code:
import { BookmarkIcon, HeartIcon, StarIcon } from 'lucide-react'

<ToggleGroup type='multiple' variant='outline' spacing={2} size='sm'>
  <ToggleGroupItem
    value='star'
    aria-label='Toggle star'
    className='data-[state=on]:bg-transparent data-[state=on]:*:[svg]:fill-yellow-500 data-[state=on]:*:[svg]:stroke-yellow-500'
  >
    <StarIcon />
    Star
  </ToggleGroupItem>
  <ToggleGroupItem
    value='heart'
    aria-label='Toggle heart'
    className='data-[state=on]:bg-transparent data-[state=on]:*:[svg]:fill-red-500 data-[state=on]:*:[svg]:stroke-red-500'
  >
    <HeartIcon />
    Heart
  </ToggleGroupItem>
  <ToggleGroupItem
    value='bookmark'
    aria-label='Toggle bookmark'
    className='data-[state=on]:bg-transparent data-[state=on]:*:[svg]:fill-blue-500 data-[state=on]:*:[svg]:stroke-blue-500'
  >
    <BookmarkIcon />
    Bookmark
  </ToggleGroupItem>
</ToggleGroup>

components.useCase: Set of toggle buttons.
components.embeddingContext: A set of two-state buttons that can be toggled on or off Also known as: button group, segmented buttons, choice buttons. Related concepts: buttons, select, options, set. Primary use case: Set of toggle buttons. Composed of parts: ToggleGroup, ToggleGroupItem.

components.name: tooltip
components.description: Popup that displays contextual information on hover or focus. Accessible with keyboard focus support. Requires TooltipProvider wrapper.
components.usage: import { Tooltip, TooltipContent, TooltipProvider, TooltipTrigger } from '@/components/ui/tooltip'
components.useCase: Small hint on hover.
components.embeddingContext: A tooltip shows informative text when hovering over or focusing on an element. Also known as: hint, hover tip, info tooltip, helper text, title popup. Requires TooltipProvider wrapper for proper state management. Features configurable delay, positioning (side/align), and optional arrow. Accessible via keyboard focus with proper ARIA attributes.

implementation.importSpecifier: import { Tooltip, TooltipContent, TooltipProvider, TooltipTrigger } from '@/components/ui/tooltip'
